summary: A fullerene is any molecule composed entirely of carbon, in the form of a hollow sphere, ellipsoid, or tube.
full_text: Robert Floyd Curl, Jr.  is an emeritus professor of chemistry at Rice University. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1996 for the discovery of the nanomaterial buckminsterfullerene, along with Richard Smalley also of Rice University, and Harold Kroto of the University of Sussex.
title: Robert Curl
